container.heading: Correction or Amendment of Personal Records

para.text: These regulations establish procedures for a person in interest to request the correction or amendment of a personal record maintained by the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services.
These regulations do not apply to criminal history record information defined under Criminal Procedure Article, §10-201(d), Annotated Code of Maryland.
Procedures for correction or amendment of criminal history record information are provided under Criminal Procedure Article, §§10-223—10-226, Annotated Code of Maryland, and COMAR 12.15.01.07.
In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
"Custodian" has the meaning stated in State Government Article, §10-611(c), Annotated Code of Maryland.
"Personal record" has the meaning stated in State Government Article, §10-624(a), Annotated Code of Maryland.
"Person in interest" has the meaning stated in State Government Article, §10-611(e), Annotated Code of Maryland.
"Public record" has the meaning stated in State Government Article, §10-611(g), Annotated Code of Maryland.

section.heading: Requesting Correction or Amendment of a Personal Record.
section.text: A person in interest requesting to correct or amend a personal record shall:

para.text: Make the request in writing;
Identify the personal record to be corrected or amended;
State the precise correction or amendment requested;
State the reason for the correction or amendment; and
Direct the request to:
The custodian of the record; or
If the custodian is unknown, the Executive Director of the Human Resources Division for the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services.

section.heading: Response to a Request to Correct or Amend a Personal Record.
section.text: Within 30 days of receipt of the request for correction or amendment, the custodian of the record shall:

para.text: Make the requested correction or amendment and inform the person in interest, in writing, of the action; or
Inform the person in interest, in writing, that the requested correction or amendment will not be acted on because:
The person making the request is not a person in interest;
The record to be corrected or amended is not a personal record;
The personal record requested to be corrected or amended is correct; or
Of any other reason that is authorized by law.

section.heading: Disagreement with Refusal to Correct or Amend a Personal Record.

para.text: If the custodian refuses a requested correction or amendment of a personal record, the person in interest may file with the head of the agency that has authority over the personal record a concise statement of the reasons for disagreeing with the agency's refusal to make the correction or amendment.
The person in interest filing a statement under §A of this regulation shall:
File the statement in writing;
Submit the statement on one side of 81/2 x 11 inches paper; and
Limit the statement to a maximum of five pages.

If a custodian discloses, to a third party, information from a personal record related to a statement filed under §A of this regulation, the custodian shall provide the third party a copy of that statement.
A person in interest may request an administrative review by filing a written request with the Secretary of Public Safety and Correctional Services, if the person in interest has been denied:
An amendment or correction of a record;
The right to file a statement; or
The right to have a statement forwarded to a third party.
A request for review shall be filed within 30 days of the date the person in interest is advised of the agency's action.

The Secretary, or a designee, shall require that an administrative review under §A of this regulation be conducted under State Government Article, Title 10, Subtitle 2, Annotated Code of Maryland, and COMAR 12.11.04.
